The Daily English Capsuletext/plain*Countable and Uncountable Nouns Quiz*

1. Countable nouns are always things that you can
a) touch
b) count
c) see

2. We use "the" with plural countable nouns
a) always
b) never
c) sometimes

3. The ------------------------------text/html<div dir=3D"ltr"><b>Countable and Uncountable Nouns Quiz</b><br><br>1. Coun=
table nouns are always things that you can<br>a) touch =C2=A0<br>b) count =
=C2=A0<br>c) see<br><br>2. We use &quot;the&quo

The Daily English Capsuletext/plain*'Be' and 'Get'*

The verb 'be' has eight different forms: be, am, is, are, was, were, being,
been.

=E2=97=8F She [is]/[was] angry --=C2=AD describes a state

The Daily English Capsuletext/plain*Adjectives: -ED or -ING endings? An Exercise*

Are you very bored? Or boring?!

The -ed or -ing ending of an adjective can completely alter the meaning of
a sentence. Use them carefully!

[Broadcast] Research Proposal Seminar of Ms. Sabarija A Mtext/plainDear All,

Ms. Sabarija A M  who is working with the guidance of Dr. Praveena

*BALANCED SITTING *

*17/04/2022*

The Daily English Capsuletext/plain*Using Was/Were/Wasn't (ie: was not) /Weren't (ie: were not)*

Consider these examples:
1) *Were you *at the supermarket an hour ago? Yes* I was.* (Or, No, *I
wasn't*)

The Daily English Capsuletext/plain*Three common errors explained:*

*You Need Not to vs. You Need Not*

an event. When used as a modal verb, 'need' doesn=E2=80=------------------------------text/html<div dir=3D"ltr"><b><u>Three common errors explained:</u></b><div><b><br></=

 used to indicate certainty, possibility or pr

[Broadcast] MINDFUL PRACTICE: DAY 243text/plainDAY 243
12/06/2022

*FOREST VISUALIZATION *
=E2=99=A6 Close your eyes and set a timer for at least five minutes.
=E2=99=A6 Visualize yourself sitting in the center of a beautiful forest.

The Daily English Capsuletext/plain*Syllables Quiz*

syllable (noun): a unit of pronunciation that has one vowel sound, and may
or may not be surrounded by consonants. A syllable can form a whole word or
part of a word.

Re: PROFESSIONAL ETHICS_AUG-DEC_2021text/plain*SUMMARY WRITING INSTRUCTIONS: *

takes a singular verb - contains

Form correct sentences : Using connectorstext/plain*Consider this sentence: *

Mammooty is a versatile actor in the Malayalam film industry. He has
enacted different types of roles than *as compared to* Mohanlal.

Both 'than' and 'as compared to' are ------------------------------text/html<div dir=3D"ltr"><div><span><span style=3D"color:rgb(0,0,0);background-colo=
r:transparent;font-variant-numeric:normal;font-variant-east-asian:normal;ve=
rtical-align:baseline;white-space:pre-wrap"><f

[Broadcast] Mindful Practice: Day 26text/plain*2631/10/2021SO HAPPY AND GRATEFUL*

Gratitude unlocks new possibilities. Today, you will practice being
grateful for the things you have.

[Broadcast] Interaction on World Mental Health Daytext/plainGreetings from The Wellness Club!

Correct the sentencestext/plain*1.*

*Wrong*  She doesn=E2=80=99t listen me.

*Right*     She doesn=E2=80=99t listen to me.

The verb =E2=80=98listen=E2=80=99, always goes with the preposition =E2=80=
=98to=E2=80=99. It is possible------------------------------text/html<div dir=3D"ltr"><div dir=3D"ltr"><p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin:0i=
n 0in 10pt;line-height:115%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Calibri,sans-serif">=
<b>1.</b></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D
**********************************
Re: Correct the sentencestext/plain*1.*

*Incorrect:*            I have visited Malampuzha last weekend.

*Correct:*                I visited Malampuzha last weekend.

You can say =E2=80=98I have visited=E2=80=99 XYZ place, if it is *n------------------------------text/html<div dir=3D"ltr"><div dir=3D"ltr"><p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin:0i=
n 0in 10pt;line-height:115%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Calibri,sans-serif">=
<b>1.</b></p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D
**********************************
Re: Correct the sentencestext/plain1.

*Incorrect: *I have completed both doses of the Covid vaccine

*Correct: *I have had/taken both doses of the Covid vaccine

''Completed'' is used when we finish something that has a clear beginnin------------------------------text/html<div dir=3D"ltr"><div dir=3D"ltr"><p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin:0i=
n 0in 10pt;line-height:115%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Calibri,sans-serif">=
1.</p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin
**********************************
Correct the sentencestext/plain1.

*Incorrect: *He did not wrote the test last week.

*Correct: *He did not write the test last week.

The helping verb 'did' is followed by the present tense of the verb and not
the past tense form.------------------------------text/html<div dir=3D"ltr"><div dir=3D"ltr"><p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin:0i=
n 0in 10pt;line-height:115%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Calibri,sans-serif">=
1.</p>

<p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"margin
**********************************

 =?utf-8?q?P/e=2C_is_it_too_expensive=3F?=text/plainTrending Stories from Money Business

-----


Question: What does the P/E ratio tell about a stock? If a stock is at 97 P=
/e, is it too expensive?

Answer from Gagan Chandra

First Understand how to ------------------------------text/html<html><head><style type=3D"text/css">

Regarding registration for Computer Visiontext/plainRespected sir,
